channel.title: AutoMerchanter, does one exist?
channel.description:
I'd like to make a script which can buy and sell items automatically. If anyone knows of such a script (in any language) could you please provide a link? I'd rather not re-invent the wheel if I dont need to, and maybe I can get some ideas from one if it doesn't meet my expectations.
Thanks.

item.title: AutoMerchanter, does one exist?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

It can definitely be done. Look for these (they may be different in your version of aryan, but should be similar at least)

acceptTrade() - first trade
confirmTrade() - second trade
getOtherTradeAccepted() - see if other accepted
getOtherTradeAcceptedStackSizes() - double check time, other confirmed, check what they offered again before confirming yourself
getOtherTradeOffer() - check what they offered (individual items, a stack of 6k feathers will show as 1)
getOtherTradeOfferStackSizes() - count stacked items (notes, feathers, etc) offered in first trade screen
getPlayerTradeAccepted() - checks what you offered after you accepted first trade
getPlayerTradeAcceptedStackSizes() - same as above but checks stackables and notes
getPlayerTradeOffer() - checks what you offered before you accept
getPlayerTradeOfferStackSizes() - same as above but checks notes/stackables
isTradeAcceptedOther() - check if other player accepted initial trade
isTradeAcceptedPlayer() - check if you accepted initial trade
isTradeConfirmedOther() - did other player confirm trade?
isTradeConfirmedPlayer() - did you confirm trade?

Got sick of this, no one will write you one, but here’s the rest minus description (It’s all in AccessorMethods.java anyway. So unless you downloaded an incredibly gay version where they don’t provide docs or java files, you can find it yourself.

offerAll(int, int)
offerItem(int, int)
offerX(int, int, int)
removeAll(int, int)
removeItem(int, int)
removeX(int, int, int)

And there are constants for the trade windows as well.

Read full topic

item.title: AutoMerchanter, does one exist?
item.dc:creator: @hellz hellz
item.description:
@hellz wrote:

Yes, I’m sure there are ways you can make more money than this by autoing, but I’m doing it more because I see it as a challenge and also as something that is mundane in the game. I always have stuff I need to buy and sell, and this would be very useful to me.

Muerte, take your time, I’m still learning the aryan API but I know java alright. Hopefully you won’t mind my lack of experience.

Read full topic

item.title: AutoMerchanter, does one exist?
item.dc:creator: @hellz hellz
item.description:
@hellz wrote:

muerte, perhaps we could work together. Here’s some key features I had in mind.

-spamming of course, and multiple items at that.
-gui to allow users to setup multiple buying items, the price to buy for, and maximum amount to buy total
-make it move around randomly within a given radius so it doesn’t look like a bot
-allow it to hop servers or teleport if sales are slow

as for selling stuff, it wouldn’t be difficult to do, but I’d like to get the buying part down first because usually finding buyers of raw materials in bulk is pretty easy.

Read full topic

item.title: AutoMerchanter, does one exist?
item.dc:creator: @muerte4 muerte4
item.description:
@muerte4 wrote:

i’ve thought about this, and it actually sounds easy lol, I will give it a go later. Basically ask the user what they are merchanting, give the bot a certain amount of money, let say 100k. Here’s the cool bit, make a variable called max.

int max = currentCash / 100

max is the maximum number of cowhides you could buy with 100k. NOW, when you get your bot to autotalk you could make it say: “buying” + max + “cowhides, 100 ea!”. Next make sure you check currentCash after every trade to work out what your new max is. When max is less than something low like 100, then start selling =D. When you start selling them however, the bot has to wait until the player has offered cash before offering any cowhides (otherwise it can’t calculate how much to offer) Alternatively, it can offer all cowhides, wait for the person offer money and then change it’s offer accordingly. You could even get the bot to ask once in a trade screen if no money has been offered, to ask “how many do you want to buy” and then later extract the number typed by the player your trading with

XD I so want to make this script now, hope it gave some people ideas.

Read full topic
